meanings.definition: A person who uses strength or power to harm or intimidate those who are weaker.
meanings.sent1: The bullies at school made the other kids feel scared.
meanings.sent2: The bullies were mean to the smaller children on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The bullies thought they were tough, but they were just being mean.
meanings.sent4: The bullies' actions cast a dark shadow over the schoolyard.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bullies picking on the younger students was unsettling.

meanings.definition: To use strength or power to harm or intimidate others.
meanings.sent1: She bullies her classmates by taking their toys without asking.
meanings.sent2: He bullies his little brother by teasing him constantly.
meanings.sent3: The cat bullies the dog by stealing its bed every night.
meanings.sent4: The storm bullies the trees, bending them with its strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The bully bullies others to feel powerful and in control.

meanings.definition: Plural form of bully, referring to more than one person who bullies.
meanings.sent1: The bullies in the group all laughed at the same time.
meanings.sent2: The bullies on the team were known for their aggressive behavior.
meanings.sent3: The bullies in the movie were actually portrayed as quite silly characters.
meanings.sent4: The bullies' words stung like a swarm of angry bees.
meanings.sent5: The bullies' presence loomed large in the school hallway.
